quotes: in June 2013 to 331 in April 2022.
In 2018, Nabiullina supported raising the retirement age and stated that this measure would “have a positive impact on the labor market.”
in 2015, Nabiullina received the Euromoney magazine award as the best head of the Central Bank in the world,
in 2017–2021 she was among the top 100 most influential women in the world according to Forbes.
In September 2016, Nabiullina was awarded 6th place in the ranking of the best heads of central banks in the world according to the Global Finance magazine.
in November 2023, Nabiullina topped Politico magazine’s rating in the “disruptor” category for her contribution to strengthening the Russian economy.
but at the end of March 2022, Bloomberg reported that Nabiullina was going to resign after the start of a full-scale invasion of Ukraine,
the Order of Honor “For great contribution to the development and strengthening of the banking system” (2018),
the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, IV degree (2012),
the Order of Friendship (2011),
medal of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland » I degree (2006),
medal of the Order “For Merit to the Fatherland” II degree (2002).
awarded in 2003 by the Institute for the Economy in Transition (now the Yegor Gaidar Institute for Economic Policy).

organizations.name: State Duma of the Russian Federation
quotes: Mikhail Delyagin stated that she “provides for the interests of financial speculators, ignoring the interests of the real sector, and has specially built such a policy of reserving risks that banks that do not have serious political protection simply cannot lend to the real sector.”
